hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (BTC 10-day realized volatility < 40% annualized) in a NEUTRAL regime, the INITIAL breakout attempt—whether upward or downward—will fail and reverse towards the prior range within 3 trading days, offering a contrarian fade opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility in a Neutral regime indicates equilibrium and a lack of conviction. The first breakout attempt often traps late momentum traders and is met with opposing liquidity from range-bound participants. The below-average volume on the initial move suggests a lack of broad market participation, increasing the odds of a fakeout.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility < 40% (annualized) for at least 5 consecutive days.
BTC price breaks out of its 5-day price range (high or low) by more than 1.5%.
The breakout occurs on below-average volume for the first 4 hours of the trading day (initial suspicion of a false move).

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midpoint of the pre-breakout 5-day range.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends the breakout move by an additional 2% beyond the entry signal level (breakout confirms).

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the breakout continues with momentum (price moves an additional 2%) and is accompanied by rising volume, the hypothesis is falsified. This indicates the breakout was genuine and marked a regime transition, not a false signal.
